server.event

Class TaskScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.event.TaskScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class TaskScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A class which schedules the execution of Tasks.
    Author:
    Graham

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TaskScheduler()
      Creates and starts the task scheduler.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void run()
      This method is automatically called every cycle by the ScheduledExecutorService and executes, adds and removes Tasks.
      void schedule(Task task)
      Schedules the specified task.
      void terminate()
      Stops the task scheduler.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskScheduler

        public TaskScheduler()
        Creates and starts the task scheduler.

    • Method Detail

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Stops the task scheduler.

      • schedule

        public void schedule(Task task)
        Schedules the specified task. If this scheduler has been stopped with the terminate() method the task will not be executed or garbage-collected.
        Parameters:
        task - The task to schedule.

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is automatically called every cycle by the ScheduledExecutorService and executes, adds and removes Tasks. It should not be called directly as this will lead to concurrency issues and inaccurate time-keeping.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
